articles.content: New Delhi: GARI, Indias first social crypto-token, witnessed strong volumes on the first day of trading as tokens worth $100 million (nearly Rs 750 crore) exchanged hands, the company said in a relea… [+1597 chars]

articles.title: Ceat's first quarterly loss in a decade drags its shares to a new low - Mint
articles.description: Another sore point for Ceat investors was its rising debt. For 9MFY22, net debt stood at  ₹2,260 crore versus  ₹1,156 crore in 9MFY21. The management said subdued market scenario and rising input costs continue to put pressure on margin, leading to an increas…
